intro: Simira hatschbachiorum, commonly known as the yellow mallow, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its yellow flowers and palmate leaves, which are often used in traditional medicine. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded areas. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
